intro: Trema rigidum, commonly known as the rigid trema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. Its small, pink or white flowers are borne in clusters and are followed by distinctive, globose fruits. Trema rigidum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including woodland and scrublands.
